That branch of biology which treats, in particular, of the organs of animals and plants. See Morphology.

Organum.def: An organ or instrument; hence, a method by which philosophical or scientific investigation may be conducted; -- a term adopted from the Aristotelian writers by Lord Bacon, as the title ("Novum Organon") of part of his treatise on philosophical method.

Organonymy.def: The designation or nomenclature of organs.

Organophyly.def: The tribal history of organs, -- a branch of morphophyly.

Organoplastic.def: Having the property of producing the tissues or organs of animals and plants; as, the organoplastic cells.

Organotrophic.def: Relating to the creation, organization, and nutrition of living organs or parts.

Organule.def: One of the essential cells or elements of an organ. See Sense organule, under Sense.

Organzine.def: A kind of double thrown silk of very fine texture, that is, silk twisted like a rope with different strands, so as to increase its strength.

Orgasm.def: Eager or immoderate excitement or action; the state of turgescence of any organ; erethism; esp., the height of venereal excitement in sexual intercourse.

Orgeat.def: A sirup in which, formerly, a decoction of barley entered, but which is now prepared with an emulsion of almonds, -- used to flavor beverages or edibles.

Orgiastic.def: Pertaining to, or of the nature of, orgies.

Orgies.def: A sacrifice accompanied by certain ceremonies in honor of some pagan deity; especially, the ceremonies observed by the Greeks and Romans in the worship of Dionysus, or Bacchus, which were characterized by wild and dissolute revelry.

Orgue.def: Any one of a number of long, thick pieces of timber, pointed and shod with iron, and suspended, each by a separate rope, over a gateway, to be let down in case of attack.
A piece of ordnance, consisting of a number of musket barrels arranged so that a match or train may connect with all their touchholes, and a discharge be secured almost or quite simultaneously.

Orgy.def: A frantic revel; drunken revelry. See Orgies

Orgyia.def: A genus of bombycid moths whose caterpillars (esp. those of Orgyia leucostigma) are often very injurious to fruit trees and shade trees. The female is wingless. Called also vaporer moth.

Orichalceous.def: Pertaining to, or resembling, orichalch; having a color or luster like that of brass.

Orichalch.def: A metallic substance, resembling gold in color, but inferior in value; a mixed metal of the ancients, resembling brass; -- called also aurichalcum, orichalcum, etc.

Oriel.def: A small apartment next a hall, where certain persons were accustomed to dine; a sort of recess.
A bay window. See Bay window.

Orient.def: Bright; lustrous; superior; pure; perfect; pellucid; -- used of gems and also figuratively, because the most perfect jewels are found in the East.
The part of the horizon where the sun first appears in the morning; the east.
The countries of Asia or the East.
To define the position of, in relation to the orient or east; hence, to ascertain the bearings of.
Fig.: To correct or set right by recurring to first principles; to arrange in order; to orientate.

Oriental.def: Of or pertaining to the orient or east; eastern; concerned with the East or Orientalism; -- opposed to occidental; as, Oriental countries.
A native or inhabitant of the Orient or some Eastern part of the world; an Asiatic.
Eastern Christians of the Greek rite.

Orientalism.def: Any system, doctrine, custom, expression, etc., peculiar to Oriental people.
Knowledge or use of Oriental languages, history, literature, etc.

Orientalist.def: An inhabitant of the Eastern parts of the world; an Oriental.
One versed in Eastern languages, literature, etc.; as, the Paris Congress of Orientalists.

Orientality.def: The quality or state of being oriental or eastern.

Orientalize.def: to render Oriental; to cause to conform to Oriental manners or conditions.

Orientate.def: To place or turn toward the east; to cause to assume an easterly direction, or to veer eastward.
To arrange in order; to dispose or place (a body) so as to show its relation to other bodies, or the relation of its parts among themselves.
To move or turn toward the east; to veer from the north or south toward the east.

Orientation.def: The act or process of orientating; determination of the points of the compass, or the east point, in taking bearings.
The tendency of a revolving body, when suspended in a certain way, to bring the axis of rotation into parallelism with the earth's axis.
An aspect or fronting to the east; especially (Arch.), the placing of a church so that the chancel, containing the altar toward which the congregation fronts in worship, will be on the east end.
Fig.: A return to first principles; an orderly arrangement.

Orientness.def: The quality or state of being orient or bright; splendor.

Orifice.def: A mouth or aperture, as of a tube, pipe, etc.; an opening; as, the orifice of an artery or vein; the orifice of a wound.

Oriflamme.def: The ancient royal standard of France.
A standard or ensign, in battle.

Origanum.def: A genus of aromatic labiate plants, including the sweet marjoram (O. Marjorana) and the wild marjoram (O. vulgare).

Origenism.def: The opinions of Origen of Alexandria, who lived in the 3d century, one of the most learned of the Greek Fathers. Prominent in his teaching was the doctrine that all created beings, including Satan, will ultimately be saved.

Origenist.def: A follower of Origen of Alexandria.

Origin.def: The first existence or beginning of anything; the birth.
That from which anything primarily proceeds; the fountain; the spring; the cause; the occasion.
The point of attachment or end of a muscle which is fixed during contraction; -- in contradistinction to insertion.

Original.def: Pertaining to the origin or beginning; preceding all others; first in order; primitive; primary; pristine; as, the original state of man; the original laws of a country; the original inventor of a process.
Not copied, imitated, or translated; new; fresh; genuine; as, an original thought; an original process; the original text of Scripture.
Having the power to suggest new thoughts or combinations of thought; inventive; as, an original genius.
Before unused or unknown; new; as, a book full of original matter.
That which precedes all others of its class; archetype; first copy; hence, an original work of art, manuscript, text, and the like, as distinguished from a copy, translation, etc.
An original thinker or writer; an originator.
The natural or wild species from which a domesticated or cultivated variety has been derived; as, the wolf is thought by some to be the original of the dog, the blackthorn the original of the plum.

Originality.def: The quality or state of being original.

Originally.def: In the original time, or in an original manner; primarily; from the beginning or origin; not by derivation, or imitation.
At first; at the origin; at the time of formation or costruction; as, a book originally written by another hand.

Originalness.def: The quality of being original; originality.

Originate.def: To give an origin or beginning to; to cause to be; to bring into existence; to produce as new.
To take first existence; to have origin or beginning; to begin to exist or act; as, the scheme originated with the governor and council.

Origination.def: The act or process of bringing or coming into existence; first production.
Mode of production, or bringing into being.

Originative.def: Having power, or tending, to originate, or bring into existence; originating.

Orillon.def: A semicircular projection made at the shoulder of a bastion for the purpose of covering the retired flank, -- found in old fortresses.

Oriole.def: Any one of various species of Old World singing birds of the family Oriolidae. They are usually conspicuously colored with yellow and black. The European or golden oriole (Oriolus galbula, or O. oriolus) has a very musical flutelike note.
In America, any one of several species of the genus Icterus, belonging to the family Icteridae. See Baltimore oriole, and Orchard oriole, under Orchard.

Orion.def: A large and bright constellation on the equator, between the stars Aldebaran and Sirius. It contains a remarkable nebula visible to the naked eye.

Oriskany.def: Designating, or pertaining to, certain beds, chiefly limestone, characteristic of the latest period of the Silurian age.

Orismology.def: That departament of natural history which treats of technical terms.

Orkneyan.def: Of or pertaining to the Orkney islands.

Orle.def: A bearing, in the form of a fillet, round the shield, within, but at some distance from, the border.
The wreath, or chaplet, surmounting or encircling the helmet of a knight and bearing the crest.

Orleans.def: A cloth made of worsted and cotton, -- used for wearing apparel.
A variety of the plum. See under Plum.

Orlo.def: A wind instrument of music in use among the Spaniards.

Orlop.def: The lowest deck of a vessel, esp. of a ship of war, consisting of a platform laid over the beams in the hold, on which the cables are coiled.

Ormolu.def: A variety of brass made to resemble gold by the use of less zinc and more copper in its composition than ordinary brass contains. Its golden color is often heightened by means of lacquer of some sort, or by use of acids. Called also mosaic gold.

Ormuzd.def: The good principle, or being, of the ancient Persian religion. See Ahriman.

Ornament.def: That which embellishes or adorns; that which adds grace or beauty; embellishment; decoration; adornment.
To adorn; to deck; to embellish; to beautify; as, to ornament a room, or a city.

Ornamental.def: Serving to ornament; characterized by ornament; beautifying; embellishing.

Ornamentation.def: The act or art of ornamenting, or the state of being ornamented.

Ornate.def: Finely finished, as a style of composition.

Ornithic.def: Of or pertaining to birds; as, ornithic fossils.

Ornithichnite.def: The footmark of a bird occurring in strata of stone.

Ornithichnology.def: The branch of science which treats of ornithichnites.

Ornitho-.def: A combining form fr. Gr. /, /, a bird.

Ornithoidichnite.def: A fossil track resembling that of a bird.

Ornitholite.def: The fossil remains of a bird.
A stone of various colors bearing the figures of birds.

Ornithologist.def: One skilled in ornithology; a student of ornithology; one who describes birds.

Ornithology.def: That branch of zoology which treats of the natural history of birds and their classification.
A treatise or book on this science.

Ornithomancy.def: Divination by means of birds, their flight, etc.

Ornithopappi.def: An extinct order of birds. It includes only the Archaeopteryx.

Ornithopoda.def: An order of herbivorous dinosaurs with birdlike characteristics in the skeleton, esp. in the pelvis and hind legs, which in some genera had only three functional toes, and supported the body in walking as in Iguanodon. See Illust. in Appendix.

Ornithosauria.def: An order of extinct flying reptiles; -- called also Pterosauria.

Ornithoscelida.def: A group of extinct Reptilia, intermediate in structure (especially with regard to the pelvis) between reptiles and birds.

Ornithoscopy.def: Observation of birds and their habits.

Ornithotomist.def: One who is skilled in ornithotomy.

Ornithotomy.def: The anatomy or dissection of birds.

Orography.def: That branch of science which treats of mountains and mountain systems; orology; as, the orography of Western Europe.

Orohippus.def: A genus of American Eocene mammals allied to the horse, but having four toes in front and three behind.

Oroide.def: An alloy, chiefly of copper and zinc or tin, resembling gold in color and brilliancy.

Orology.def: The science or description of mountains.

Orotund.def: Characterized by fullness, clearness, strength, and smoothness; ringing and musical; -- said of the voice or manner of utterance.

Orphan.def: A child bereaved of both father and mother; sometimes, also, a child who has but one parent living.
Bereaved of parents, or (sometimes) of one parent.
To cause to become an orphan; to deprive of parents.

Orphanage.def: The state of being an orphan; orphanhood; orphans, collectively.
An institution or asylum for the care of orphans.

Orphanhood.def: The state or condition of being an orphan; orphanage.

Orphanotrophism.def: The care and support of orphans.

Orpharion.def: An old instrument of the lute or cittern kind.

Orphean.def: Of or pertaining to Orpheus, the mythic poet and musician; as, Orphean strains.

Orpheus.def: The famous mythic Thracian poet, son of the Muse Calliope, and husband of Eurydice. He is reputed to have had power to entrance beasts and inanimate objects by the music of his lyre.

Orphic.def: Pertaining to Orpheus; Orphean; as, Orphic hymns.

Orphrey.def: A band of rich embroidery, wholly or in part of gold, affixed to vestments, especially those of ecclesiastics.

Orpiment.def: Arsenic sesquisulphide, produced artificially as an amorphous lemonyellow powder, and occurring naturally as a yellow crystalline mineral; -- formerly called auripigment. It is used in king's yellow, in white Indian fire, and in certain technical processes, as indigo printing.

Orpin.def: A yellow pigment of various degrees of intensity, approaching also to red.

Orpine.def: A low plant with fleshy leaves (Sedum telephium), having clusters of purple flowers. It is found on dry, sandy places, and on old walls, in England, and has become naturalized in America. Called also stonecrop, and live-forever.

Orrery.def: An apparatus which illustrates, by the revolution of balls moved by wheelwork, the relative size, periodic motions, positions, orbits, etc., of bodies in the solar system.

Orris.def: A plant of the genus Iris (I. Florentina); a kind of flower-de-luce. Its rootstock has an odor resembling that of violets.
A sort of gold or silver lace.
A peculiar pattern in which gold lace or silver lace is worked; especially, one in which the edges are ornamented with conical figures placed at equal distances, with spots between them.

Orsedue.def: Leaf metal of bronze; Dutch metal. See under Dutch.

Orsellic.def: Pertaining to, or designating, an acid found in certain lichens, and called also lecanoric acid.

Orsellinic.def: Pertaining to, or designating, an organic acid obtained by a partial decomposition of orsellic acid as a white crystalline substance, and related to protocatechuic acid.

Ort.def: A morsel left at a meal; a fragment; refuse; -- commonly used in the plural.

Ortalidian.def: Any one of numerous small two-winged flies of the family Ortalidae. The larvae of many of these flies live in fruit; those of others produce galls on various plants.

Orthid.def: A brachiopod shell of the genus Orthis, and allied genera, of the family Orthidae.

Orthis.def: An extinct genus of Brachiopoda, abundant in the Paleozoic rocks.

Orthite.def: A variety of allanite occurring in slender prismatic crystals.

Ortho-.def: A combining form signifying straight, right, upright, correct, regular; as, orthodromy, orthodiagonal, orthodox, orthographic.
The one of several acids of the same element (as the phosphoric acids), which actually occurs with the greatest number of hydroxyl groups; as, orthophosphoric acid.  Cf. Normal.

Connection with, or affinity to, one variety of isomerism, characteristic of the benzene compounds; -- contrasted with meta- or para-; as, the ortho position; hence, designating any substance showing such isomerism; as, an ortho compound.

Orthocarbonic.def: Designating a complex ether, C.(OC2H5)4, which is obtained as a liquid of a pleasant ethereal odor by means of chlorpicrin, and is believed to be a derivative of the hypothetical normal carbonic acid, C.(OH)4.

Orthocenter.def: That point in which the three perpendiculars let fall from the angles of a triangle upon the opposite sides, or the sides produced, mutually intersect.

Orthoceras.def: An extinct genus of Paleozoic Cephalopoda, having a long, straight, conical shell. The interior is divided into numerous chambers by transverse septa.

Orthoceratite.def: An orthoceras; also, any fossil shell allied to Orthoceras.

Orthoclase.def: Common or potash feldspar crystallizing in the monoclinic system and having two cleavages at right angles to each other. See Feldspar.

Orthoclastic.def: Breaking in directions at right angles to each other; -- said of the monoclinic feldspars.

Orthodiagonal.def: The diagonal or lateral axis in a monoclinic crystal which is at right angles with the vertical axis.

Orthodox.def: Sound in opinion or doctrine, especially in religious doctrine; hence, holding the Christian faith; believing the doctrines taught in the Scriptures; -- opposed to heretical and heterodox; as, an orthodox Christian.
According or congruous with the doctrines of Scripture, the creed of a church, the decree of a council, or the like; as, an orthodox opinion, book, etc.

Orthodoxal.def: Pertaining to, or evincing, orthodoxy; orthodox.

Orthodoxical.def: Pertaining to, or evincing, orthodoxy; orthodox.

Orthodoxly.def: In an orthodox manner; with soundness of faith.

Orthodoxness.def: The quality or state of being orthodox; orthodoxy.

Orthodoxy.def: Soundness of faith; a belief in the doctrines taught in the Scriptures, or in some established standard of faith; -- opposed to heterodoxy or to heresy.
Consonance to genuine Scriptural doctrines; -- said of moral doctrines and beliefs; as, the orthodoxy of a creed.
By extension, said of any correct doctrine or belief.

Orthodromics.def: The art of sailing in a direct course, or on the arc of a great circle, which is the shortest distance between any two points on the surface of the globe; great-circle sailing; orthodromy.

Orthodromy.def: The act or art of sailing on a great circle.

Orthoepical.def: Of or pertaining to orthoepy, or correct pronunciation.

Orthoepist.def: One who is skilled in orthoepy.

Orthoepy.def: The art of uttering words correctly; a correct pronunciation of words; also, mode of pronunciation.

Orthogamy.def: Direct fertilization in plants, as when the pollen fertilizing the ovules comes from the stamens of the same blossom; -- opposed to heterogamy.

Orthognathism.def: The quality or state of being orthognathous.

Orthognathous.def: Having the front of the head, or the skull, nearly perpendicular, not retreating backwards above the jaws; -- opposed to prognathous. See Gnathic index, under Gnathic.

Orthogonal.def: Right-angled; rectangular; as, an orthogonal intersection of one curve with another.

Orthogonally.def: Perpendicularly; at right angles; as, a curve cuts a set of curves orthogonally.

Orthographer.def: One versed in orthography; one who spells words correctly.

Orthographical.def: Of or pertaining to orthography, or right spelling; also, correct in spelling; as, orthographical rules; the letter was orthographic.
Of or pertaining to right lines or angles.

Orthographically.def: according to the rules of proper spelling

Orthographist.def: One who spells words correctly; an orthographer.

Orthographize.def: To spell correctly or according to usage; to correct in regard to spelling.

Orthography.def: The art or practice of writing words with the proper letters, according to standard usage; conventionally correct spelling; also, mode of spelling; as, his orthography is vicious.
The part of grammar which treats of the letters, and of the art of spelling words correctly.
A drawing in correct projection, especially an elevation or a vertical section.

Orthometric.def: Having the axes at right angles to one another; -- said of crystals or crystalline forms.

Orthometry.def: The art or practice of constructing verses correctly; the laws of correct versification.

Orthopedical.def: Pertaining to, or employed in, orthopedy; relating to the prevention or cure of deformities of children, or, in general, of the human body at any age; as, orthopedic surgery; an orthopedic hospital.

Orthopedist.def: One who prevents, cures, or remedies deformities, esp. in children.

Orthopedy.def: The art or practice of curing the deformities of children, or, by extension, any deformities of the human body.

Orthophony.def: The art of correct articulation; voice training.

Orthopinacoid.def: A name given to the two planes in the monoclinic system which are parallel to the vertical and orthodiagonal axes.

Orthopny.def: Specifically, a morbid condition in which respiration can be performed only in an erect posture; by extension, any difficulty of breathing.

Orthopoda.def: An extinct order of reptiles which stood erect on the hind legs, and resembled birds in the structure of the feet, pelvis, and other parts.

Orthopraxy.def: The treatment of deformities in the human body by mechanical appliances.

Orthoptera.def: An order of mandibulate insects including grasshoppers, locusts, cockroaches, etc. See Illust. under Insect.

Orthopterous.def: Of or pertaining to the Orthoptera.

Orthorhombic.def: Noting the system of crystallization which has three unequal axes at right angles to each other; trimetric. See Crystallization.

Orthoscope.def: An instrument designed to show the condition of the superficial portions of the eye.

Orthoscopic.def: Giving an image in correct or normal proportions; giving a flat field of view; as, an orthoscopic eyepiece.

Orthosilicic.def: Designating the form of silicic acid having the normal or highest number of hydroxyl groups.

Orthospermous.def: Having the seeds straight, as in the fruits of some umbelliferous plants; -- opposed to coelospermous.

Orthostade.def: A chiton, or loose, ungirded tunic, falling in straight folds.

Orthostichy.def: A longitudinal rank, or row, of leaves along a stem.

Orthotomous.def: Having two cleavages at right angles with one another.

Orthotomy.def: The property of cutting at right angles.

Orthotone.def: Retaining the accent; not enclitic; -- said of certain indefinite pronouns and adverbs when used interrogatively, which, when not so used, are ordinarilly enclitic.

Orthotropous.def: Having the axis of an ovule or seed straight from the hilum and chalaza to the orifice or the micropyle; atropous.

Orthotropic.def: Having the longer axis vertical; -- said of erect stems.

Orthoxylene.def: That variety of xylene in which the two methyl groups are in the ortho position; a colorless, liquid, combustible hydrocarbon resembling benzene.

Ortive.def: Of or relating to the time or act of rising; eastern; as, the ortive amplitude of a planet.

Ortolan.def: A European singing bird (Emberiza hortulana), about the size of the lark, with black wings. It is esteemed delicious food when fattened. Called also bunting.
In America, the sora, or Carolina rail (Porzana Carolina). See Sora.

Ortygan.def: One of several species of East Indian birds of the genera Ortygis and Hemipodius.  They resemble quails, but lack the hind toe. See Turnix.

Orvietan.def: A kind of antidote for poisons; a counter poison formerly in vogue.

-ory.def: An adjective suffix meaning of or pertaining to, serving for; as in auditory, pertaining to or serving for hearing; prohibitory, amendatory, etc.
A noun suffix denoting that which pertains to, or serves for; as in ambulatory, that which serves for walking; consistory, factory, etc.

Oryctology.def: An old name for mineralogy and geology.

Oryx.def: A genus of African antelopes which includes the gemsbok, the leucoryx, the bisa antelope (O. beisa), and the beatrix antelope (O. beatrix) of Arabia.

Oryza.def: A genus of grasses including the rice plant; rice.

Os.def: A mouth; an opening; an entrance.

One of the ridges of sand or gravel found in Sweden, etc., supposed by some to be of marine origin, but probably formed by subglacial waters. The osar are similar to the kames of Scotland and the eschars of Ireland. See Eschar.

Osage orange.def: An ornamental tree of the genus Maclura (M. aurantiaca), closely allied to the mulberry (Morus); also, its fruit. The tree was first found in the country of the Osage Indians, and bears a hard and inedible fruit of an orangelike appearance. See Bois d'arc.

Osages.def: A tribe of southern Sioux Indians, now living in the Indian Territory.

Oscan.def: Of or pertaining to the Osci, a primitive people of Campania, a province of ancient Italy.

Oscillancy.def: The state of oscillating; a seesaw kind of motion.

Oscillaria.def: A genus of dark green, or purplish black, filamentous, fresh-water algae, the threads of which have an automatic swaying or crawling motion. Called also Oscillatoria.

Oscillate.def: To move backward and forward; to vibrate like a pendulum; to swing; to sway.
To vary or fluctuate between fixed limits; to act or move in a fickle or fluctuating manner; to change repeatedly, back and forth.

Oscillation.def: The act of oscillating; a swinging or moving backward and forward, like a pendulum; vibration.
Fluctuation; variation; change back and forth.

Oscillatory.def: Moving, or characterized by motion, backward and forward like a pendulum; swinging; oscillating; vibratory; as, oscillatory motion.

Oscines.def: Singing birds; a group of the Passeres, having numerous syringeal muscles, conferring musical ability.

Oscinian.def: One of the Oscines, or singing birds.
Any one of numerous species of dipterous files of the family Oscinidae.

Oscinine.def: Of or pertaining to the Oscines.

Oscitancy.def: The act of gaping or yawning.

Oscitation.def: The act of yawning or gaping.

Osculant.def: Adhering closely; embracing; -- applied to certain creeping animals, as caterpillars.

Intermediate in character, or on the border, between two genera, groups, families, etc., of animals or plants, and partaking somewhat of the characters of each, thus forming a connecting link; interosculant; as, the genera by which two families approximate are called osculant genera.

Osculate.def: To touch closely, so as to have a common curvature at the point of contact. See Osculation, 2.
To kiss one another; to kiss.
To have characters in common with two genera or families, so as to form a connecting link between them; to interosculate. See Osculant.

Osculation.def: The act of kissing; a kiss.
The contact of one curve with another, when the number of consecutive points of the latter through which the former passes suffices for the complete determination of the former curve.

Osculatory.def: Of or pertaining to kissing; kissing.
Pertaining to, or having the properties of, an osculatrix; capable of osculation; as, a circle may be osculatory with a curve, at a given point.

Osculatrix.def: A curve whose contact with a given curve, at a given point, is of a higher order (or involves the equality of a greater number of successive differential coefficients of the ordinates of the curves taken at that point) than that of any other curve of the same kind.

Oscule.def: One of the excurrent apertures of sponges.

-ose.def: A suffix denoting full of, containing, having the qualities of, like; as in verbose, full of words; pilose, hairy; globose, like a globe.
A suffix indicating that the substance to the name of which it is affixed is a member of the carbohydrate group; as in cellulose, sucrose, dextrose, etc.

Osier.def: A kind of willow (Salix viminalis) growing in wet places in Europe and Asia, and introduced into North America. It is considered the best of the willows for basket work. The name is sometimes given to any kind of willow.
One of the long, pliable twigs of this plant, or of other similar plants.
Made of osiers; composed of, or containing, osiers.

Osiered.def: Covered or adorned with osiers; as, osiered banks.

Osiris.def: One of the principal divinities of Egypt, the brother and husband of Isis. He was figured as a mummy wearing the royal cap of Upper Egypt, and was symbolized by the sacred bull, called Apis.  Cf. Serapis.

Osmanli.def: A Turkish official; one of the dominant tribe of Turks; loosely, any Turk.

Osmaterium.def: One of a pair of scent organs which the larvae of certain butterflies emit from the first body segment, either above or below.

Osmazome.def: A substance formerly supposed to give to soup and broth their characteristic odor, and probably consisting of one or several of the class of nitrogenous substances which are called extractives.

Osmiamic.def: Of, pertaining to, or designating, a nitrogenous acid of osmium, H2N2Os2O5, forming a well-known series of yellow salts.

Osmic.def: Pertaining to, derived from, or containing, osmium; specifically, designating those compounds in which it has a valence higher than in other lower compounds; as, osmic oxide.

Osmious.def: Denoting those compounds of osmium in which the element has a valence relatively lower than in the osmic compounds; as, osmious chloride.

Osmium.def: A rare metallic element of the platinum group, found native as an alloy in platinum ore, and in iridosmine. It is a hard, infusible, bluish or grayish white metal, and the heaviest substance known. Its tetroxide is used in histological experiments to stain tissues. Symbol Os. Atomic weight 191.1.  Specific gravity 22.477.

Osmometer.def: An instrument for measuring the amount of osmotic action in different liquids.

Osmometry.def: The study of osmose by means of the osmometer.

Osmose.def: The tendency in fluids to mix, or become equably diffused, when in contact. It was first observed between fluids of differing densities, and as taking place through a membrane or an intervening porous structure. The more rapid flow from the thinner to the thicker fluid was then called endosmose, and the opposite, slower current, exosmose. Both are, however, results of the same force. Osmose may be regarded as a form of molecular attraction, allied to that of adhesion.
The action produced by this tendency.

Osmotic.def: Pertaining to, or having the property of, osmose; as, osmotic force.

Osmund.def: A fern of the genus Osmunda, or flowering fern. The most remarkable species is the osmund royal, or royal fern (Osmunda regalis), which grows in wet or boggy places, and has large bipinnate fronds, often with a panicle of capsules at the top.  The rootstock contains much starch, and has been used in stiffening linen.

Osnaburg.def: A species of coarse linen, originally made in Osnaburg, Germany.

Oso-berry.def: The small, blueblack, drupelike fruit of the Nuttallia cerasiformis, a shrub of Oregon and California, belonging to the Cherry tribe of Rosaceae.

Osphradium.def: The olfactory organ of some Mollusca. It is connected with the organ of respiration.

Ossean.def: A fish having a bony skeleton; a teleost.

Ossein.def: The organic basis of bone tissue; the residue after removal of the mineral matters from bone by dilute acid; in embryonic tissue, the substance in which the mineral salts are deposited to form bone; -- called also ostein. Chemically it is the same as collagen.

Osselet.def: The internal bone, or shell, of a cuttlefish.

Osseous.def: Composed of bone; resembling bone; capable of forming bone; bony; ossific.

Ossianic.def: Of or pertaining to, or characteristic of, Ossian, a legendary Erse or Celtic bard.

Ossicle.def: A little bone; as, the auditory ossicles in the tympanum of the ear.
One of numerous small calcareous structures forming the skeleton of certain echinoderms, as the starfishes.

Ossific.def: Capable of producing bone; having the power to change cartilage or other tissue into bone.

Ossification.def: The formation of bone; the process, in the growth of an animal, by which inorganic material (mainly lime salts) is deposited in cartilage or membrane, forming bony tissue; ostosis.
The state of being changed into a bony substance; also, a mass or point of ossified tissue.

Ossified.def: Changed to bone or something resembling bone; hardened by deposits of mineral matter of any kind; -- said of tissues.

Ossifrage.def: The young of the sea eagle or bald eagle.

Ossify.def: To form into bone; to change from a soft animal substance into bone, as by the deposition of lime salts.
Fig.: To harden; as, to ossify the heart.
To become bone; to change from a soft tissue to a hard bony tissue.

Ossifying.def: Changing into bone; becoming bone; as, the ossifying process.

Ossivorous.def: Feeding on bones; eating bones; as, ossivorous quadrupeds.

Ossuary.def: A place where the bones of the dead are deposited; a charnel house.

Ostensibility.def: The quality or state of being ostensible.

Ostensible.def: Capable of being shown; proper or intended to be shown.
Shown; exhibited; declared; avowed; professed; apparent; -- often used as opposed to real or actual; as, an ostensible reason, motive, or aim.

Ostensibly.def: In an ostensible manner; avowedly; professedly; apparently.

Ostension.def: The showing of the sacrament on the altar in order that it may receive the adoration of the communicants.

Ostentate.def: To make an ambitious display of; to show or exhibit boastingly.

Ostentation.def: The act of ostentating or of making an ambitious display; unnecessary show; pretentious parade; -- usually in a detractive sense.

Ostentatious.def: Fond of, or evincing, ostentation; unduly conspicuous; pretentious; boastful.

Ostentator.def: One fond of display; a boaster.

Osteo-.def: A combining form of Gr. / a bone.

Osteoblast.def: One of the protoplasmic cells which occur in the osteogenetic layer of the periosteum, and from or around which the matrix of the bone is developed; an osteoplast.

Osteoclasis.def: The operation of breaking a bone in order to correct deformity.

Osteocolla.def: A kind of glue obtained from bones.
A cellular calc tufa, which in some places forms incrustations on the stems of plants, -- formerly supposed to have the quality of uniting fractured bones.

Osteocomma.def: A metamere of the vertebrate skeleton; an osteomere; a vertebra.

Osteocope.def: Pain in the bones; a violent fixed pain in any part of a bone.

Osteocranium.def: The bony cranium, as distinguished from the cartilaginous cranium.

Osteodentine.def: A hard substance, somewhat like bone, which is sometimes deposited within the pulp cavity of teeth.

Osteogen.def: The soft tissue, or substance, which, in developing bone, ultimately undergoes ossification.

Osteogeny.def: The formation or growth of bone.

Osteogenetic.def: Connected with osteogenesis, or the formation of bone; producing bone; as, osteogenetic tissue; the osteogenetic layer of the periosteum.

Osteolite.def: A massive impure apatite, or calcium phosphate.

Osteologer.def: One versed in osteology; an osteologist.

Osteologist.def: One who is skilled in osteology; an osteologer.

Osteology.def: The science which treats of the bones of the vertebrate skeleton.

Osteoma.def: A tumor composed mainly of bone; a tumor of a bone.

Osteomalacia.def: A disease of the bones, in which they lose their earthy material, and become soft, flexible, and distorted. Also called malacia.

Osteophone.def: An instrument for transmission of auditory vibrations through the bones of the head, so as to be appreciated as sounds by persons deaf from causes other than those affecting the nervous apparatus of hearing.

Osteoplastic.def: Of or pertaining to the replacement of bone; as, an osteoplastic operation.

Osteoplasty.def: An operation or process by which the total or partial loss of a bone is remedied.

Osteopterygious.def: Having bones in the fins, as certain fishes.

Osteosarcoma.def: A tumor having the structure of a sacroma in which there is a deposit of bone; sarcoma connected with bone.

Osteotome.def: Strong nippers or a chisel for dividing bone.

Osteotomy.def: The dissection or anatomy of bones; osteology.
The operation of dividing a bone or of cutting a piece out of it, -- done to remedy deformity, etc.

Ostiary.def: The mouth of a river; an estuary.
One who keeps the door, especially the door of a church; a porter.

Ostic.def: Pertaining to, or applied to, the language of the Tuscaroras, Iroquois, Wyandots, Winnebagoes, and a part of the Sioux Indians.

Ostiole.def: The exterior opening of a stomate. See Stomate.

Ostmen.def: East men; Danish settlers in Ireland, formerly so called.

Ostosis.def: Bone formation; ossification. See Ectostosis, and Endostosis.

Ostracea.def: A division of bivalve mollusks including the oysters and allied shells.

Ostracean.def: Any one of a family of bivalves, of which the oyster is the type.

Ostracion.def: A genus of plectognath fishes having the body covered with solid, immovable, bony plates. It includes the trunkfishes.

Ostraciont.def: A fish of the genus Ostracion and allied genera.

Ostracism.def: Banishment by popular vote, -- a means adopted at Athens to rid the city of a person whose talent and influence gave umbrage.

Ostracize.def: To exile by ostracism; to banish by a popular vote, as at Athens.
To banish from society; to put under the ban; to cast out from social, political, or private favor; as, he was ostracized by his former friends.

Ostracodermi.def: A suborder of fishes of which Ostracion is the type.

Ostracoid.def: Of or pertaining to the Ostracoidea.

Ostracoidea.def: An order of Entomostraca possessing hard bivalve shells. They are of small size, and swim freely about.

Ostrea.def: A genus of bivalve Mollusca which includes the true oysters.

Ostreaceous.def: Of or pertaining to an oyster, or to a shell; shelly.

Ostrich.def: A large bird of the genus Struthio, of which Struthio camelus of Africa is the best known species. It has long and very strong legs, adapted for rapid running; only two toes; a long neck, nearly bare of feathers; and short wings incapable of flight. The adult male is about eight feet high.

Ostrogoth.def: One of the Eastern Goths. See Goth.

Ostrogothic.def: Of or pertaining to the Ostrogoths.

Oswego tea.def: An American aromatic herb (Monarda didyma), with showy, bright red, labiate flowers.

Otacoustic.def: Assisting the sense of hearing; as, an otacoustic instrument.

Otacousticon.def: An instrument to facilitate hearing, as an ear trumpet.

Otaheite apple.def: The fruit of a Polynesian anacardiaceous tree (Spondias dulcis), also called vi-apple. It is rather larger than an apple, and the rind has a flavor of turpentine, but the flesh is said to taste like pineapples.
A West Indian name for a myrtaceous tree (Jambosa Malaccensis) which bears crimson berries.

Otheoscope.def: An instrument for exhibiting the repulsive action produced by light or heat in an exhausted vessel; a modification of the radoimeter.

Other.def: Either; -- used with other or or for its correlative (as either . . . or are now used).
Different from that which, or the one who, has been specified; not the same; not identical; additional; second of two.
Not this, but the contrary; opposite; as, the other side of a river.
Alternate; second; -- used esp. in connection with every; as, every other day, that is, each alternate day, every second day.

Otherguess.def: Of another kind or sort; in another way.

Otherness.def: The quality or state of being other or different; alterity; oppositeness.

Otherwhere.def: In or to some other place, or places; elsewhere.

Otherwhiles.def: At another time, or other times; sometimes; /ccasionally.

Otherwise.def: In a different manner; in another way, or in other ways; differently; contrarily.
In different circumstances; under other conditions; as, I am engaged, otherwise I would accept.

Otic.def: Of, pertaining to, or in the region of, the ear; auricular; auditory.

Otiose.def: Being at leisure or ease; unemployed; indolent; idle.

Otis.def: A genus of birds including the bustards.

Oto-.def: A combining form denoting relation to, or situation near or in, the ear.

Otoba fat.def: A colorless buttery substance obtained from the fruit of Myristica otoba, a species of nutmeg tree.

Otocrane.def: The cavity in the skull in which the parts of the internal ear are lodged.

Otocranial.def: Of or pertaining to the otocrane.

Otocyst.def: An auditory cyst or vesicle; one of the simple auditory organs of many invertebrates, containing a fluid and otoliths; also, the embryonic vesicle from which the parts of the internal ear of vertebrates are developed.

Otolite.def: One of the small bones or particles of calcareous or other hard substance in the internal ear of vertebrates, and in the auditory organs of many invertebrates; an ear stone. Collectively, the otoliths are called ear sand and otoconite.

Otologist.def: One skilled in otology; an aurist.

Otology.def: The branch of science which treats of the ear and its diseases.

Otopathy.def: A diseased condition of the ear.

Otorrh/a.def: A flow or running from the ear, esp. a purulent discharge.

Otoscope.def: An instrument for examining the condition of the ear.

Otoscopeic.def: Of or pertaining to the otoscope or to otoscopy.

Otoscopy.def: The examination of the ear; the art of using the otoscope.

Otozoum.def: An extinct genus of huge vertebrates, probably dinosaurs, known only from four-toed tracks in Triassic sandstones.

Ottawas.def: A tribe of Indians who, when first known, lived on the Ottawa River. Most of them subsequently migrated to the southwestern shore of Lake Superior.

Otter.def: Any carnivorous animal of the genus Lutra, and related genera. Several species are described. They have large, flattish heads, short ears, and webbed toes. They are aquatic, and feed on fish. Their fur is soft and valuable. The common otter of Europe is Lutra vulgaris; the American otter is L. Canadensis; other species inhabit South America and Asia.
The larva of the ghost moth. It is very injurious to hop vines.

Ottoman.def: Of or pertaining to the Turks; as, the Ottoman power or empire.
A stuffed seat without a back, originally used in Turkey.

Ottrelite.def: A micaceous mineral occurring in small scales. It is characteristic of certain crystalline schists.

Ouakari.def: Any South American monkey of the genus Brachyurus, especially B. ouakari.

Ouarine.def: A Brazilian monkey of the genus Mycetes.

Oubliette.def: A dungeon with an opening only at the top, found in some old castles and other strongholds, into which persons condemned to perpetual imprisonment, or to perish secretly, were thrust, or lured to fall.

Ouch.def: A socket or bezel holding a precious stone; hence, a jewel or ornament worn on the person.

Ought.def: Was or were under obligation to pay; owed.
To be bound in duty or by moral obligation.
To be necessary, fit, becoming, or expedient; to behoove; -- in this sense formerly sometimes used impersonally or without a subject expressed.

Oughtness.def: The state of being as a thing ought to be; rightness.

Ounce.def: A weight, the sixteenth part of a pound avoirdupois, and containing 437/ grains.
The twelfth part of a troy pound.
Fig.: A small portion; a bit.

A feline quadruped (Felis irbis, / uncia) resembling the leopard in size, and somewhat in color, but it has longer and thicker fur, which forms a short mane on the back. The ounce is pale yellowish gray, with irregular dark spots on the neck and limbs, and dark rings on the body. It inhabits the lofty mountain ranges of Asia. Called also once.

Ouphe.def: A fairy; a goblin; an elf.

Our.def: Of or pertaining to us; belonging to us; as, our country; our rights; our troops; our endeavors. See I.

Ourebi.def: A small, graceful, and swift African antelope, allied to the klipspringer.

Ourselves.def: ; sing. Ourself (/). An emphasized form of the pronoun of the first person plural; -- used as a subject, usually with we; also, alone in the predicate, in the nominative or the objective case.

-ous.def: An adjective suffix meaning full of, abounding in, having, possessing the qualities of, like; as in gracious, abounding in grace; arduous, full of ardor; bulbous, having bulbs, bulblike; riotous, poisonous, piteous, joyous, etc.

A suffix denoting that the element indicated by the name bearing it, has a valence lower than that denoted by the termination -ic; as, nitrous, sulphurous, etc., as contrasted with nitric, sulphuric, etc.

Ousel.def: One of several species of European thrushes, especially the blackbird (Merula merula, or Turdus merula), and the mountain or ring ousel (Turdus torquatus).

Ouster.def: A putting out of possession; dispossession; ejection; disseizin.

Out.def: In its original and strict sense, out means from the interior of something; beyond the limits or boundary of somethings; in a position or relation which is exterior to something; -- opposed to in or into. The something may be expressed after of, from, etc. (see Out of, below); or, if not expressed, it is implied; as, he is out; or, he is out of the house, office, business, etc.; he came out; or, he came out from the ship, meeting, sect, party, etc.
Away; abroad; off; from home, or from a certain, or a usual, place; not in; not in a particular, or a usual, place; as, the proprietor is out, his team was taken out.

Beyond the limits of concealment, confinement, privacy, constraint, etc., actual of figurative; hence, not in concealment, constraint, etc., in, or into, a state of freedom, openness, disclosure, publicity, etc.; as, the sun shines out; he laughed out, to be out at the elbows; the secret has leaked out, or is out; the disease broke out on his face; the book is out.
Beyond the limit of existence, continuance, or supply; to the end; completely; hence, in, or into, a condition of extinction, exhaustion, completion; as, the fuel, or the fire, has burned out.

Beyond possession, control, or occupation; hence, in, or into, a state of want, loss, or deprivation; -- used of office, business, property, knowledge, etc.; as, the Democrats went out and the Whigs came in; he put his money out at interest.

Beyond the bounds of what is true, reasonable, correct, proper, common, etc.; in error or mistake; in a wrong or incorrect position or opinion; in a state of disagreement, opposition, etc.; in an inharmonious relation.
Not in the position to score in playing a game; not in the state or turn of the play for counting or gaining scores.
One who, or that which, is out; especially, one who is out of office; -- generally in the plural.
A place or space outside of something; a nook or corner; an angle projecting outward; an open space; -- chiefly used in the phrase ins and outs; as, the ins and outs of a question. See under In.
A word or words omitted by the compositor in setting up copy; an omission.
To cause to be out; to eject; to expel.
To come out with; to make known.
To give out; to dispose of; to sell.
To come or go out; to get out or away; to become public.
Expressing impatience, anger, a desire to be rid of; -- with the force of command; go out; begone; away; off.

Outact.def: To do or beyond; to exceed in acting.

Outargue.def: To surpass or conquer in argument.

Outbabble.def: To utter foolishly or excessively; to surpass in babbling.

Outbalance.def: To outweight; to exceed in weight or effect.

Outbid.def: To exceed or surpass in bidding.

Outblush.def: To exceed in blushing; to surpass in rosy color.

Outboard.def: Beyond or outside of the lines of a vessel's bulwarks or hull; in a direction from the hull or from the keel; -- opposed to inboard; as, outboard rigging; swing the davits outboard.

Outbounds.def: The farthest or exterior bounds; extreme limits; boundaries.

Outbrag.def: To surpass in bragging; hence, to make appear inferior.

Outbrave.def: To excel in bravery o/ in insolence; to defy with superior courage or audacity
To excel in magnificence or comeliness.

Outbrazen.def: To bear down with a brazen face; to surpass in impudence.

Outbreast.def: To surpass in singing. See Breast, n., 6.

Outbreathe.def: To cause to be out of breath; to exhaust.
To issue, as breath; to be breathed out; to exhale.

Outbuild.def: To exceed in building, or in durability of building.

Outbuilding.def: A building separate from, and subordinate to, the main house; an outhouse.

Outburn.def: To burn entirely; to be consumed.

Outcast.def: One who is cast out or expelled; an exile; one driven from home, society, or country; hence, often, a degraded person; a vagabond.

Outclimb.def: To climb bevond; to surpass in climbing.

Outcome.def: That which comes out of, or follows from, something else; issue; result; consequence; upshot.

Outcompass.def: To exceed the compass or limits of.

Outcrier.def: One who cries out or proclaims; a herald or crier.

Outcrop.def: The coming out of a stratum to the surface of the ground.
That part of inclined strata which appears at the surface; basset.
To come out to the surface of the ground; -- said of strata.

Outcry.def: A vehement or loud cry; a cry of distress, alarm, opposition, or detestation; clamor.

Outdare.def: To surpass in daring; to overcome by courage; to brave.

Outdo.def: To go beyond in performance; to excel; to surpass.

Outdoor.def: Being, or done, in the open air; being or done outside of certain buildings, as poorhouses, hospitals, etc.; as, outdoor exercise; outdoor relief; outdoor patients.

Outdoors.def: Abread; out of the house; out of doors.

Outdream.def: To pass, or escape, while dreaming.

Outdweller.def: One who holds land in a parish, but lives elsewhere.

Outer.def: Being on the outside; external; farthest or farther from the interior, from a given station, or from any space or position regarded as a center or starting place; -- opposed to inner; as, the outer wall; the outer court or gate; the outer stump in cricket; the outer world.
The part of a target which is beyond the circles surrounding the bull's-eye.
A shot which strikes the outer of a target.
One who puts out, ousts, or expels; also, an ouster; dispossession.

Outermost.def: Being on the extreme external part; farthest outward; as, the outermost row.

Outface.def: To face or look (one) out of countenance; to resist or bear down by bold looks or effrontery; to brave.

Outfall.def: The mouth of a river; the lower end of a water course; the open end of a drain, culvert, etc., where the discharge occurs.

Outfangthef.def: A thief from without or abroad, taken within a lord's fee or liberty.
The privilege of trying such a thief.

Outfield.def: Arable land which has been or is being exhausted. See Infield, 1.
A field beyond, or separated from, the inclosed land about the homestead; an uninclosed or unexplored tract. Also used figuratively.
The part of the field beyond the diamond, or infield. It is occupied by the fielders.
The part of the field farthest from the batsman.

Outfit.def: A fitting out, or equipment, as of a ship for a voyage, or of a person for an expedition in an unoccupied region or residence in a foreign land; things required for equipment; the expense of, or allowance made for, equipment, as by the government of the United States to a diplomatic agent going abroad.

Outfitter.def: One who furnishes outfits for a voyage, a journey, or a business.

Outflank.def: To go beyond, or be superior to, on the flank; to pass around or turn the flank or flanks of.

Outfly.def: To surpass in flying; to fly beyond or faster than.

Outfrown.def: To frown down; to overbear by frowning.

Outgaze.def: To gaze beyond; to exceed in sharpness or persistence of seeing or of looking; hence, to stare out of countenance.

Outgeneral.def: To exceed in generalship; to gain advantage over by superior military skill or executive ability; to outmaneuver.

Outgo.def: To go beyond; to exceed in swiftness; to surpass; to outdo.
That which goes out, or is paid out; outlay; expenditure; -- the opposite of income.

Outgoer.def: One who goes out or departs.

Outgoing.def: The act or the state of going out.
That which goes out; outgo; outlay.
The extreme limit; the place of ending.
Going out; departing; as, the outgoing administration; an outgoing steamer.

Outground.def: Ground situated at a distance from the house; outlying land.

Outgrow.def: To surpass in growing; to grow more than.
To grow out of or away from; to grow too large, or too aged, for; as, to outgrow clothing; to outgrow usefulness; to outgrow an infirmity.

Outgrowth.def: That which grows out of, or proceeds from, anything; an excrescence; an offshoot; hence, a result or consequence.

Outguard.def: A guard or small body of troops at a distance from the main body of an army, to watch for the approach of an enemy; hence, anything for defense placed at a distance from the thing to be defended.

Outgush.def: To gush out; to flow forth.

Outhaul.def: A rope used for hauling out a sail upon a spar; -- opposite of inhaul.

Out-Herod.def: To surpass (Herod) in violence or wickedness; to exceed in any vicious or offensive particular.

Outhouse.def: A small house or building at a little distance from the main house; an outbuilding.

Outing.def: The act of going out; an airing; an excursion; as, a summer outing.
A feast given by an apprentice when he is out of his time.

Outjest.def: To surpass in jesting; to drive out, or away, by jesting.

Outjet.def: That which jets out or projects from anything.

Outkeeper.def: An attachment to a surveyor's compass for keeping tally in chaining.

Outlandish.def: Hence: Not according with usage; strange; rude; barbarous; uncouth; clownish; as, an outlandish dress, behavior, or speech.

Outlast.def: To exceed in duration; to survive; to endure longer than.

Outlaugh.def: To surpass or outdo in laughing.
To laugh (one) out of a purpose, principle, etc.; to discourage or discomfit by laughing; to laugh down.

Outlaw.def: A person excluded from the benefit of the law, or deprived of its protection.
To deprive of the benefit and protection of law; to declare to be an outlaw; to proscribe.
To remove from legal jurisdiction or enforcement; as, to outlaw a debt or claim; to deprive of legal force.

Outlawry.def: The act of outlawing; the putting a man out of the protection of law, or the process by which a man (as an absconding criminal) is deprived of that protection.
The state of being an outlaw.

Outlay.def: To lay out; to spread out; to display.

Outlearn.def: To excel or surpass in learing.
To learn out [i. e., completely, utterly]; to exhaust knowledge of.

Outlet.def: The place or opening by which anything is let out; a passage out; an exit; a vent.

Outlier.def: One who does not live where his office, or business, or estate, is.
That which lies, or is, away from the main body.
A part of a rock or stratum lying without, or beyond, the main body, from which it has been separated by denudation.

Outlimb.def: An extreme member or part of a thing; a limb.

Outline.def: The line which marks the outer limits of an object or figure; the exterior line or edge; contour.
In art: A line drawn by pencil, pen, graver, or the like, by which the boundary of a figure is indicated.
A sketch composed of such lines; the delineation of a figure without shading.
Fig.: A sketch of any scheme; a preliminary or general indication of a plan, system, course of thought, etc.; as, the outline of a speech.
Fig.: To sketch out or indicate as by an outline; as, to outline an argument or a campaign.

Outlinear.def: Of or pertaining to an outline; being in, or forming, an outline.

Outlive.def: To live beyond, or longer than; to survive.

Outlook.def: The act of looking out; watch.
One who looks out; also, the place from which one looks out; a watchower.
The view obtained by one looking out; scope of vision; prospect; sight; appearance.

Outloose.def: A loosing from; an escape; an outlet; an evasion.

Outlustre.def: To excel in brightness or luster.

Outlying.def: Lying or being at a distance from the central part, or the main body; being on, or beyond, the frontier; exterior; remote; detached.

Outmanoeuvre.def: To surpass, or get an advantage of, in maneuvering; to outgeneral.

Outmantle.def: To excel in mantling; hence, to excel in splendor, as of dress.

Outmarch.def: To surpass in marching; to march faster than, or so as to leave behind.

Outmeasure.def: To exceed in measure or extent; to measure more than.

Outmost.def: Farthest from the middle or interior; farthest outward; outermost.

Outname.def: To exceed in naming or describing.
To exceed in name, fame, or degree.

Outness.def: The state of being out or beyond; separateness.
The state or quality of being distanguishable from the perceiving mind, by being in space, and possessing marerial quality; externality; objectivity.

Outnoise.def: To exceed in noise; to surpass in noisiness.

Out-of-door.def: Being out of the house; being, or done, in the open air; outdoor; as, out-of-door exercise. See Out of door, under Out, adv.

Outpace.def: To outgo; to move faster than; to leave behind.

Outparamour.def: To exceed in the number of mistresses.

Outparish.def: A parish lying without the walls of, or in a remote part of, a town.

Outpass.def: To pass beyond; to exceed in progress.

Out-patient.def: A patient who is outside a hospital, but receives medical aid from it.

Outplay.def: To excel or defeat in a game; to play better than; as, to be outplayed in tennis or ball.

Outport.def: A harbor or port at some distance from the chief town or seat of trade.

Outpost.def: A post or station without the limits of a camp, or at a distance from the main body of an army, for observation of the enemy.
The troops placed at such a station.

Outpour.def: A flowing out; a free discharge.

Outpower.def: To excel in power; to overpover.

Outpray.def: To exceed or excel in prayer.

Outprize.def: To prize beyong value, or in excess; to exceed in value.

Output.def: The amount of coal or ore put out from one or more mines, or the quantity of material produced by, or turned out from, one or more furnaces or mills, in a given time.
That which is thrown out as products of the metabolic activity of the body; the egesta other than the faeces. See Income.

Outrage.def: Injurious violence or wanton wrong done to persons or things; a gross violation of right or decency; excessive abuse; wanton mischief; gross injury.
To commit outrage upon; to subject to outrage; to treat with violence or excessive abuse.
Specifically, to violate; to commit an indecent assault upon (a female).
To be guilty of an outrage; to act outrageously.

Outrageous.def: Of the nature of an outrage; exceeding the limits of right, reason, or decency; involving or doing an outrage; furious; violent; atrocious.

Outrank.def: To exceed in rank; hence, to take precedence of.

Outre.def: Being out of the common course or limits; extravagant; bizarre.

Outreason.def: To excel or surpass in reasoning; to reason better than.

Outreckon.def: To exceed in reckoning or computation.

Outrede.def: To surpass in giving rede, or counsel.

Outreign.def: To go beyond in reigning; to reign through the whole of, or longer than.

Outride.def: To surpass in speed of riding; to ride beyond or faster than.

Outrider.def: A summoner whose office is to cite men before the sheriff.
One who rides out on horseback.
A servant on horseback attending a carriage.

Outrigger.def: Any spar or projecting timber run out for temporary use, as from a ship's mast, to hold a rope or a sail extended, or from a building, to support hoisting teckle.
A projecting support for a rowlock, extended from the side of a boat.
A projecting contrivance at the side of a boat to prevent upsetting, as projecting spars with a log at the end.

Outright.def: Immediately; without delay; at once; as, he was killed outright.

Outring.def: To excel in volume of ringing sound; to ring louder than.

Outrun.def: To exceed, or leave behind, in running; to run faster than; to outstrip; to go beyond.

Outrush.def: To rush out; to issue, or ru/ out, forcibly.

Outsail.def: To excel, or to leave behind, in sailing; to sail faster than.

Outscorn.def: To confront, or subdue, with greater scorn.

Outscouring.def: That which is scoured out o/ washed out.

Outscout.def: To overpower by disdain; to outface.

Outsee.def: To see beyond; to excel in cer/ainty of seeing; to surpass in foresight.

Outsell.def: To exceed in amount of sales; to sell more than.
To exceed in the price of selling; to fetch more than; to exceed in value.

Outsentry.def: A sentry who guards the entrance or approach to a place; an outguard.

Outset.def: A setting out, starting, or beginning.

Outsettler.def: One who settles at a distance, or away, from others.

Outshoot.def: To exceed or excel in shooting; to shoot beyond.

Outside.def: The external part of a thing; the part, end, or side which forms the surface; that which appears, or is manifest; that which is superficial; the exterior.
The part or space which lies without an inclosure; the outer side, as of a door, walk, or boundary.
The furthest limit, as to number, quantity, extent, etc.; the utmost; as, it may last a week at the outside.
One who, or that which, is without; hence, an outside passenger, as distinguished from one who is inside. See Inside, n. 3.
Of or pertaining to the outside; external; exterior; superficial.
Reaching the extreme or farthest limit, as to extent, quantity, etc.; as, an outside estimate.
or prep. On or to the outside (of); without; on the exterior; as, to ride outside the coach; he stayed outside.

Outsider.def: One not belonging to the concern, institution, party, etc., spoken of; one disconnected in interest or feeling.
A locksmith's pinchers for grasping the point of a key in the keyhole, to open a door from the outside when the key is inside.
A horse which is not a favorite in the betting.

Outsit.def: To remain sitting, or in session, longer than, or beyond the time of; to outstay.

Outskirt.def: A part remote from the center; outer edge; border; -- usually in the plural; as, the outskirts of a town.

Outslide.def: To slide outward, onward, or forward; to advance by sliding.

Outsole.def: The outside sole of a boot or shoe.

Outspan.def: To unyoke or disengage, as oxen from a wagon.

Outspoken.def: Speaking, or spoken, freely, openly, or boldly; as, an outspoken man; an outspoken rebuke.

Outspread.def: To spread out; to expand; -- usually as a past part. / adj.

Outstand.def: To stand out, or project, from a surface or mass; hence, to remain standing out.
To resist effectually; to withstand; to sustain without yielding.

Outstanding.def: That stands out; undischarged; uncollected; not paid; as, outstanding obligations.

Outstare.def: To excel or overcome in staring; to face down.

Outstay.def: To stay beyond or longer than.

Outstreet.def: A street remote from the center of a town.

Outstrike.def: To strike out; to strike faster than.

Outstrip.def: To go faster than; to outrun; to advance beyond; to leave behing.

Outtalk.def: To overpower by talking; to exceed in talking; to talk down.

Outtell.def: To surpass in telling, counting, or reckoning.

Outterm.def: An external or superficial thing; outward manner; superficial remark, etc.

Outthrow.def: To excel in throwing, as in ball playing.

Outtongue.def: To silence by talk, clamor, or noise.

Outtravel.def: To exceed in speed o/ distance traveled.

Outvote.def: To exceed in the number of votes given; to defeat by votes.

Outwalk.def: To excel in walking; to leave behind in walking.

Outwall.def: The exterior wall; the outside surface, or appearance.

Outwards.def: From the interior part; in a direction from the interior toward the exterior; out; to the outside; beyond; off; away; as, a ship bound outward.

Outward.def: Forming the superficial part; external; exterior; -- opposed to inward; as, an outward garment or layer.
Of or pertaining to the outer surface or to what is external; manifest; public.
Foreign; not civil or intestine; as, an outward war.
Tending to the exterior or outside.

Outwear.def: To wear out; to consume or destroy by wearing.
To last longer than; to outlast; as, this cloth will outwear the other.

Outweigh.def: To exceed in weight or value.

Outwin.def: To win a way out of.

Outwind.def: To extricate by winding; to unloose.

Outwing.def: To surpass, exceed, or outstrip in flying.

Outwit.def: To surpass in wisdom, esp. in cunning; to defeat or overreach by superior craft.
The faculty of acquiring wisdom by observation and experience, or the wisdom so acquired; -- opposed to inwit.

Outwork.def: To exceed in working; to work more or faster than.
A minor defense constructed beyond the main body of a work, as a ravelin, lunette, hornwork, etc.

Outwrest.def: To extort; to draw from or forth by violence.

Outwrite.def: To exceed or excel in writing.

Oval.def: Of or pertaining to eggs; done in the egg, or inception; as, oval conceptions.
Having the figure of an egg; oblong and curvilinear, with one end broader than the other, or with both ends of about the same breadth; in popular usage, elliptical.
A body or figure in the shape of an egg, or popularly, of an ellipse.

Ovalbumen.def: The albumin from white of eggs; egg albumin; -- in distinction from serum albumin. See Albumin.

Ovaliform.def: Having the form of an egg; having a figure such that any section in the direction of the shorter diameter will be circular, and any in the direction of the longer diameter will be oval.

Ovarial.def: Of or pertaining to an ovary.

Ovariole.def: One of the tubes of which the ovaries of most insects are composed.

Ovariotomist.def: One who performs, or is skilled in, ovariotomy.

Ovariotomy.def: The operation of removing one or both of the ovaries; oophorectomy.

Ovarious.def: Consisting of eggs; as, ovarious food.

Ovary.def: That part of the pistil which contains the seed, and in most flowering plants develops into the fruit. See Illust. of Flower.
The essential female reproductive organ in which the ova are produced. See Illust. of Discophora.

Ovate.def: Shaped like an egg, with the lower extremity broadest.
Having the shape of an egg, or of the longitudinal sectior of an egg, with the broader end basal.

Ovate-acuminate.def: Having an ovate form, but narrowed at the end into a slender point.

Ovate-cylindraceous.def: Having a form intermediate between ovate and cylindraceous.

Ovate-lanceolate.def: Having a form intermediate between ovate and lanceolate.

Ovate-oblong.def: Oblong. with one end narrower than the other; ovato-oblong.

Ovate-rotundate.def: Having a form intermediate between that of an egg and a sphere; roundly ovate.

Ovate-subulate.def: Having an ovate form, but with a subulate tip or extremity.

Ovation.def: A lesser kind of triumph allowed to a commander for an easy, bloodless victory, or a victory over slaves.
Hence: An expression of popular homage; the tribute of the multitude to a public favorite.

Oven.def: A place arched over with brick or stonework, and used for baking, heating, or drying; hence, any structure, whether fixed or portable, which may be heated for baking, drying, etc.; esp., now, a chamber in a stove, used for baking or roasting.

Ovenbird.def: Any species of the genus Furnarius, allied to the creepers. They inhabit South America and the West Indies, and construct curious oven-shaped nests.
In the United States, Seiurus aurocapillus; -- called also golden-crowned thrush.
In England, sometimes applied to the willow warbler, and to the long-tailed titmouse.

Over.def: Above, or higher than, in place or position, with the idea of covering; -- opposed to under; as, clouds are over our heads; the smoke rises over the city.
Across; from side to side of; -- implying a passing or moving, either above the substance or thing, or on the surface of it; as, a dog leaps over a stream or a table.
Upon the surface of, or the whole surface of; hither and thither upon; throughout the whole extent of; as, to wander over the earth; to walk over a field, or over a city.
Above; -- implying superiority in excellence, dignity, condition, or value; as, the advantages which the Christian world has over the heathen.
Above in authority or station; -- implying government, direction, care, attention, guard, responsibility, etc.; -- opposed to under.
Across or during the time of; from beginning to end of; as, to keep anything over night; to keep corn over winter.
Above the perpendicular height or length of, with an idea of measurement; as, the water, or the depth of water, was over his head, over his shoes.
Beyond; in excess of; in addition to; more than; as, it cost over five dollars.
Above, implying superiority after a contest; in spite of; notwithstanding; as, he triumphed over difficulties; the bill was passed over the veto.
From one side to another; from side to side; across; crosswise; as, a board, or a tree, a foot over, i. e., a foot in diameter.
From one person or place to another regarded as on the opposite side of a space or barrier; -- used with verbs of motion; as, to sail over to England; to hand over the money; to go over to the enemy.
Also, with verbs of being: At, or on, the opposite side; as, the boat is over.
From beginning to end; throughout the course, extent, or expanse of anything; as, to look over accounts, or a stock of goods; a dress covered over with jewels.
From inside to outside, above or across the brim.
Beyond a limit; hence, in excessive degree or quantity; superfluously; with repetition; as, to do the whole work over.
In a manner to bring the under side to or towards the top; as, to turn (one's self) over; to roll a stone over; to turn over the leaves; to tip over a cart.
At an end; beyond the limit of continuance; completed; finished.
Upper; covering; higher; superior; also, excessive; too much or too great; -- chiefly used in composition; as, overshoes, overcoat, over-garment, overlord, overwork, overhaste.
A certain number of balls (usually four) delivered successively from behind one wicket, after which the ball is bowled from behind the other wicket as many times, the fielders changing places.

Overabound.def: To be exceedingly plenty or superabundant.

Overact.def: To act or perform to excess; to exaggerate in acting; as, he overacted his part.
To act upon, or influence, unduly.
To act more than is necessary; to go to excess in action.

Overaction.def: Per/ormance to excess; exaggerated or excessive action.

Overaffect.def: To affect or care for unduly.

Overagitate.def: To agitate or discuss beyond what is expedient.

Overalls.def: A kind of loose trousers worn over others to protect them from soiling.

Overanxiety.def: The state of being overanxious; excessive anxiety.

Overanxious.def: Anxious in an excessive or needless degree.

Overarch.def: To make or place an arch over; to hang over like an arch.

Over-arm.def: Done (as bowling or pitching) with the arm raised above the shoulder. See Overhard.

Overawe.def: To awe exceedingly; to subjugate or restrain by awe or great fear.

Overawful.def: Awful, or reverential, in an excessive degree.

Overbalance.def: To exceed equality with; to outweigh.
To cause to lose balance or equilibrium.
Excess of weight or value; something more than an equivalent; as, an overbalance of exports.

Overbattle.def: Excessively fertile; bearing rank or noxious growths.

Overbear.def: To bear down or carry down, as by excess of weight, power, force, etc.; to overcome; to suppress.
To domineer over; to overcome by insolence.
To bear fruit or offspring to excess; to be too prolific.

Overbearing.def: Aggressively haughty; arrogant; domineering; tyrannical; dictatorial; insolent.

Overbid.def: To bid or offer beyond, or in excess of.

Overblow.def: To blow over, or be subdued.
To force so much wind into a pipe that it produces an overtone, or a note higher than the natural note; thus, the upper octaves of a flute are produced by overblowing.
To blow away; to dissipate by wind, or as by wind.

Overboard.def: Over the side of a ship; hence, from on board of a ship, into the water; as, to fall overboard.

Overbow.def: To bend or bow over; to bend in a contrary direction.

Overbrim.def: To flow over the brim; to be so full as to overflow.

Overbrow.def: To hang over like a brow; to impend over.

Overbuild.def: To build too much; to build beyond the demand.

Overbuilt.def: Having too many buildings; as, an overbuilt part of a town.

Overbulk.def: To oppress by bulk; to overtower.

Overburden.def: To load with too great weight or too much care, etc.
The waste which overlies good stone in a quarry.

Overburn.def: To burn too much; to be overzealous.

Overbuy.def: To buy at too dear a rate.

Overcanopy.def: To cover as with a canopy.

Overcarking.def: Too anxious; too full of care.

Overcarry.def: To carry too far; to carry beyond the proper point.

Overcast.def: To cast or cover over; hence, to cloud; to darken.
To compute or rate too high.
To take long, loose stitches over (the raw edges of a seam) to prevent raveling.

Overcautious.def: Too cautious; cautious or prudent to excess.

Overchange.def: Too much or too frequent change; fickleness.

Overcharge.def: To charge or load too heavily; to burden; to oppress; to cloy.
To fill too full; to crowd.
To charge excessively; to charge beyond a fair rate or price.
To exaggerate; as, to overcharge a description.
An excessive charge in an account.

Overcloud.def: To cover or overspread with clouds; to becloud; to overcast.

Overcoat.def: A coat worn over the other clothing; a greatcoat; a topcoat.

Overcome.def: To get the better of; to surmount; to conquer; to subdue; as, to overcome enemies in battle.
To come or pass over; to spreads over.
To gain the superiority; to be victorious.

Overconfidence.def: Excessive confidence; too great reliance or trust.

Overcount.def: To rate too high; to outnumber.

Overcrow.def: To crow, exult, or boast, over; to overpower.

Overdare.def: To dare too much or rashly; to be too daring.

Overdate.def: To date later than the true or proper period.

Overdo.def: To do too much; to exceed what is proper or true in doing; to exaggerate; to carry too far.
To overtask. or overtax; to fatigue; to exhaust; as, to overdo one's strength.
To cook too much; as, to overdo the meat.
To labor too hard; to do too much.

Overdose.def: To dose to excess; to give an overdose, or too many doses, to.
Too great a dose; an excessive dose.

Overdraw.def: To make drafts upon or against, in excess of the proper amount or limit.

Overdress.def: To dress or adorn to excess; to dress too much.

Overdtive.def: To drive too hard, or far, or beyond strength.

Overdrown.def: To wet or drench to excess.

Overdue.def: Due and more than due; delayed beyond the proper time of arrival or payment, etc.; as, an overdue vessel; an overdue note.

Overdye.def: To dye with excess of color; to put one color over (another).

Overeat.def: To gnaw all over, or on all sides.
To eat to excess; -- often with a reflexive.

Overempty.def: To make too empty; to exhaust.

Overestimate.def: To estimate too highly; to overvalue.
An estimate that is too high; as, an overestimate of the vote.

Overexcitement.def: Excess of excitement; the state of being overexcited.

Overexquisite.def: Too exquisite; too exact or nice; too careful.

Overeye.def: To superintend; to oversee; to inspect.

Overfall.def: A turbulent surface of water, caused by strong currents setting over submerged ridges; also, a dangerous submerged ridge or shoal.

Overfatigue.def: To fatigue to excess; to tire out.

Overfeed.def: To feed to excess; to surfeit.

overfill.def: To fill to excess; to surcharge.

Overflourish.def: To make excessive display or flourish of.
To embellish with outward ornaments or flourishes; to varnish over.

Overflow.def: To flow over; to cover woth, or as with, water or other fluid; to spread over; to inundate; to overwhelm.
To flow over the brim of; to fill more than full.
A flowing over, as of water or other fluid; an inundation.
That which flows over; a superfluous portion; a superabundance.
An outlet for the escape of surplus liquid.

Overflowing.def: An overflow; that which overflows; exuberance; copiousness.

Overfly.def: To cross or pass over by flight.

Overfree.def: Free to excess; too liberal; too familiar.

Overfreight.def: To put too much freight in or upon; to load too full, or too heavily; to overload.

Overfrieze.def: To cover with a frieze, or as with a frieze.

Overfront.def: To confront; to oppose; to withstand.

Overfull.def: Too full; filled to overflowing; excessively full; surfeited.

Overfullness.def: The state of being excessively or abnormally full, so as to cause overflow, distention, or congestion; excess of fullness; surfeit.

Overget.def: To reach; to overtake; to pass.
To get beyond; to get over or recover from.

Overgive.def: To give over; to surrender; to yield.

Overgloom.def: To spread gloom over; to make gloomy; to overshadow.

Overgrace.def: To grace or honor exceedingly or beyond desert.

Overgrassed.def: Overstocked, or overgrown, or covered, with grass.

Overground.def: Situated over or above ground; as, the overground portion of a plant.

Overgrow.def: To grow over; to cover with growth or herbage, esp. that which is rank.
To grow beyond; to rise above; hence, to overcome; to oppress.
To grow beyond the fit or natural size; as, a huge, overgrown ox.

Overhand.def: The upper hand; advantage; superiority; mastery.
Over and over; -- applied to a style of sewing, or to a seam, in which two edges, usually selvedges, are sewed together by passing each stitch over both.
Done (as pitching or bowling) with the hand higher than the elbow, or the arm above, or higher than, the shoulder.
In an overhand manner or style.

Overhandle.def: To handle, or use, too much; to mention too often.

Overhang.def: To hang over; to jut or project over.
In a general sense, that which just out or projects; a projection; also, the measure of the projection; as, the overhang is five feet.
Specifically: The projection of an upper part (as a roof, an upper story, or other part) of a building beyond the lower part; as, the overhang of a roof, of the eaves, etc.
The portion of the bow or stem of a vessel that projects over the water beyond the water line.
The projection of a part beyond another part that is directly below it, or beyond a part by which it is supported; as, the overhang of a shaft; i. e., its projection beyond its bearing.

Overharden.def: To harden too much; to make too hard.

Overhaul.def: To haul or drag over; hence, to turn over for examination; to inspect; to examine thoroughly with a view to corrections or repairs.
To gain upon in a chase; to overtake.

Overhauling.def: A strict examination with a view to correction or repairs.

Overhead.def: Aloft; above; in or attached to the ceiling or roof; in the story or upon the floor above; in the zenith.

Overhear.def: To hear more of (anything) than was intended to be heard; to hear by accident or artifice.

Overheat.def: To heat to excess; to superheat.

Overhip.def: To pass over by, or as by a hop; to skip over; hence, to overpass.

Overhold.def: To hold or value too highly; to estimate at too dear a rate.

Overhung.def: Suspended from above or from the top.

Overinfluence.def: To influence in an excessive degree; to have undue influence over.

Overinform.def: To inform, fill, or animate, excessively.

Overissue.def: An excessive issue; an issue, as of notes or bonds, exceeding the limit of capital, credit, or authority.

Overjoy.def: To make excessively joyful; to gratify extremely.

Overjump.def: To jump over; hence, to omit; to ignore.

Overking.def: A king who has sovereignty over inferior kings or ruling princes.

Overlabor.def: To cause to labor excessively; to overwork.
To labor upon excessively; to refine unduly.

Overlade.def: To load with too great a cargo; to overburden; to overload.

Overland.def: Being, or accomplished, over the land, instead of by sea; as, an overland journey.

Overlander.def: One who travels over lands or countries; one who travels overland.

Overlap.def: The lapping of one thing over another; as, an overlap of six inches; an overlap of a slate on a roof.
