An extension of geological beds above and beyond others, as in a conformable series of beds, when the upper beds extend over a wider space than the lower, either in one or in all directions.

Overlash.def: To drive on rashly; to go to excess; hence, to exaggerate; to boast.

Overlay.def: To lay, or spread, something over or across; hence, to cover; to overwhelm; to press excessively upon.
To smother with a close covering, or by lying upon.
A piece of paper pasted upon the tympan sheet to improve the impression by making it stronger at a particular place.

Overlayer.def: One who overlays; that with which anything is overlaid.

Overlead.def: To domineer over; to affront; to treat with indignity.

Overleap.def: To leap over or across; hence, to omit; to ignore.

Overleaven.def: To leaven too much; hence, to change excessively; to spoil.

Overlie.def: To lie over or upon; specifically, to suffocate by lying upon; as, to overlie an infant.

Overliness.def: The quality or state of being overly; carelessness.

Overlinger.def: To cause to linger; to detain too long.

Overlive.def: To live too long, too luxuriously, or too actively.

Overload.def: To load or fill to excess; to load too heavily.
An excessive load; the excess beyond a proper load.

Overlogical.def: Excessively logical; adhering too closely to the forms or rules of logic.

Overlook.def: To look down upon from a place that is over or above; to look over or view from a higher position; to rise above, so as to command a view of; as, to overlook a valley from a hill.
Hence: To supervise; to watch over; sometimes, to observe secretly; as, to overlook a gang of laborers; to overlook one who is writing a letter.
To inspect; to examine; to look over carefully or repeatedly.
To look upon with an evil eye; to bewitch by looking upon; to fascinate.

To look over and beyond (anything) without seeing it; to miss or omit in looking; hence, to refrain from bestowing notice or attention upon; to neglect; to pass over without censure or punishment; to excuse.

Overlord.def: One who is lord over another or others; a superior lord; a master.

Overlordship.def: Lordship or supremacy of a person or a people over others.

Overly.def: Careless; negligent; inattentive; superfical; not thorough.

Overlying.def: Lying over or upon something; as, overlying rocks.

Overmarch.def: To march too far, or too much; to exhaust by marching.

Overmast.def: To furnish (a vessel) with too long or too heavy a mast or masts.

Overmaster.def: To overpower; to subdue; to vanquish; to govern.

Overmatch.def: To be more than equal to or a match for; hence, to vanquish.
One superior in power; also, an unequal match; a contest in which one of the opponents is overmatched.

Overmeasure.def: To measure or estimate too largely.
Excessive measure; the excess beyond true or proper measure; surplus.

Overmorrow.def: The day after or following to-morrow.

Overmost.def: Over the rest in authority; above all others; highest.

Overmount.def: To mount over; to go higher than; to rise above.

Overmuch.def: In too great a degree; too much.

Overmuchness.def: The quality or state of being in excess; superabundance.

Overmultiply.def: To multiply or increase too much; to repeat too often.

Overname.def: To name over or in a series; to recount.

Overnight.def: The fore part of the night last past; the previous evening.
In the fore part of the night last past; in the evening before; also, during the night; as, the candle will not last overnight.

Overoffice.def: To domineer over by virtue of office.

Overofficious.def: Too busy; too ready to intermeddle; too officious.

Overpaint.def: To color or describe too strongly.

Overpamper.def: To pamper excessively; to feed or dress too much.

Overpart.def: To give too important or difficult a part to.

Overpass.def: To go over or beyond; to cross; as, to overpass a river; to overpass limits.
To pass over; to omit; to overlook; to disregard.
To pass over, away, or off.

Overpay.def: To pay too much to; to reward too highly.

Overpeer.def: To peer over; to rise above.

Overperch.def: To perch upon; to fly over.

Overpersuade.def: To persuade or influence against one's inclination or judgment.

Overpicture.def: To surpass nature in the picture or representation of.

Overplus.def: That which remains after a supply, or beyond a quantity proposed; surplus.

Overply.def: To ply to excess; to exert with too much vigor; to overwork.

Overpost.def: To post over; to pass over swiftly, as by post.

Overpower.def: To excel or exceed in power; to cause to yield; to vanquish; to subdue; as, the light overpowers the eyes.

Overpowering.def: Excelling in power; too powerful; irresistible.

Overpraising.def: The act of praising unduly; excessive praise.

Overpress.def: To bear upon with irresistible force; to crush; to overwhelm.

Overproduction.def: Excessive production; supply beyond the demand.

Overprompt.def: Too prompt; too ready or eager; precipitate.

Overproof.def: Containing more alcohol than proof spirit; stronger than proof spirit; that is, containing more than 49.3 per cent by weight of alcohol.

Overproportion.def: To make of too great proportion.

Overrake.def: To rake over, or sweep across, from end to end, as waves that break over a vessel anchored with head to the sea.

Overrate.def: To rate or value too highly.

Overreach.def: To reach above or beyond in any direction.
To deceive, or get the better of, by artifice or cunning; to outwit; to cheat.
To strike the toe of the hind foot against the heel or shoe of the forefoot; -- said of horses.
To sail on one tack farther than is necessary.
To cheat by cunning or deception.
The act of striking the heel of the fore foot with the toe of the hind foot; -- said of horses.

Overreacher.def: One who overreaches; one who cheats; a cheat.

Override.def: To ride over or across; to ride upon; to trample down.
To suppress; to destroy; to supersede; to annul; as, one low overrides another; to override a veto.
To ride beyond; to pass; to outride.
To ride too much; to ride, as a horse, beyond its strength.

Overrule.def: To rule over; to govern or determine by superior authority.
To rule or determine in a contrary way; to decide against; to abrogate or alter; as, God overrules the purposes of men; the chairman overruled the point of order.
To supersede, reject, annul, or rule against; as, the plea, or the decision, was overruled by the court.
To be superior or supreme in rulling or controlling; as, God rules and overrules.

Overruler.def: One who, or that which, controls, governs, or determines.

Overruling.def: Exerting controlling power; as, an overruling Providence.

Overrun.def: To run over; to grow or spread over in excess; to invade and occupy; to take possession of; as, the vine overran its trellis; the farm is overrun with witch grass.
To exceed in distance or speed of running; to go beyond or pass in running.
To go beyond; to extend in part beyond; as, one line overruns another in length.
To abuse or oppress, as if by treading upon.
To carry over, or back, as type, from one line or page into the next after, or next before.
To extend the contents of (a line, column, or page) into the next line, column, or page.
To run, pass, spread, or flow over or by something; to be beyond, or in excess.
To extend beyond its due or desired length; as, a line, or advertisement, overruns.

Overscented.def: Covered or concealed by a different odor.

Overscrupulousness.def: The quality or state of being overscrupulous; excess of scrupulousness.

Oversee.def: To superintend; to watch over; to direct; to look or see after; to overlook.
To see too or too much; hence, to be deceived.

Overseer.def: One who oversees; a superintendent; a supervisor; as, an overseer of a mill; specifically, one or certain public officers; as, an overseer of the poor; an overseer of highways.

Oversell.def: To sell for a higher price than; to exceed in selling price.
To sell beyond means of delivery.

Overset.def: To turn or tip (anything) over from an upright, or a proper, position so that it lies upon its side or bottom upwards; to upset; as, to overset a chair, a coach, a ship, or a building.
To cause to fall, or to tail; to subvert; to overthrow; as, to overset a government or a plot.
To turn, or to be turned, over; to be upset.
An upsetting; overturn; overthrow; as, the overset of a carriage.

Overshade.def: To cover with shade; to render dark or gloomy; to overshadow.

Overshadow.def: To throw a shadow, or shade, over; to darken; to obscure.
Fig.: To cover with a superior influence.

Overshadower.def: One that throws a shade, or shadow, over anything.

Overshake.def: To shake over or away; to drive away; to disperse.

Overshine.def: To shine over or upon; to illumine.
To excel in shining; to outshine.

Overshoe.def: A shoe that is worn over another for protection from wet or for extra warmth; esp., an India-rubber shoe; a galoche.

Overshoot.def: To pass swiftly over; to fly beyond.
To exceed; as, to overshoot the truth.

Oversight.def: An overlooking; an omission; an error.

Overskip.def: To skip or leap over; to treat with indifference.

Overskirt.def: An upper skirt, shorter than the dress, and usually draped.

Overslaugh.def: A bar in a river; as, the overslaugh in the Hudson River.
To hinder or stop, as by an overslaugh or an impediment; as, to overslaugh a bill in a legislative body; to overslaugh a military officer, that is, to hinder his promotion or employment.

Oversleep.def: To sleep beyond; as, to oversleep one's self or one's usual hour of rising.

Overslip.def: To slip or slide over; to pass easily or carelessly beyond; to omit; to neglect; as, to overslip time or opportunity.

Overslow.def: To render slow; to check; to curb.

Oversman.def: An umpire; a third arbiter, appointed when two arbiters, previously selected, disagree.

Oversnow.def: To cover with snow, or as with snow.

Oversorrow.def: To grieve or afflict to excess.

Oversow.def: To sow where something has already been sown.

Overspeak.def: To exceed in speaking; to speak too much; to use too many words.

Overspin.def: To spin out to too great length; to protract unduly.

Overspread.def: To spread over; to cover; as, the deluge overspread the earth.
To be spread or scattered over.

Overstand.def: To stand on the price or conditions of, so as to lose a sale; to lose by an extravagant price or hard conditions.

Overstate.def: To state in too strong terms; to exaggerate.

Overstay.def: To stay beyond the time or the limits of; as, to overstay the appointed time.

Overstep.def: To step over or beyond; to transgress.

Overstock.def: To fill too full; to supply in excess; as, to overstock a market with goods, or a farm with cattle.

Over-story.def: The clearstory, or upper story, of a building.

Overstrain.def: To strain one's self to excess.
To stretch or strain too much; as to overstrain one's nerves.

Oversum.def: A sum or quantity over; surplus.

Overswell.def: To swell or rise above; to overflow.

Overt.def: Open to view; public; apparent; manifest.
Not covert; open; public; manifest; as, an overt act of treason.

Overtake.def: To come up with in a course, pursuit, progress, or motion; to catch up with.
To come upon from behind; to discover; to surprise; to capture; to overcome.
Hence, figuratively, in the past participle (overtaken), drunken.

Overtax.def: To tax or to task too heavily.

Overtempt.def: To tempt exceedingly, or beyond the power of resistance.

Overthrow.def: To throw over; to overturn; to upset; to turn upside down.
To cause to fall or to fail; to subvert; to defeat; to make a ruin of; to destroy.
The act of overthrowing; the state of being overthrow; ruin.
The act of throwing a ball too high, as over a player's head.
A faulty return of the ball by a fielder, so that the striker makes an additional run.

Overthwart.def: Having a transverse position; placed or situated across; hence, opposite.
Crossing in kind or disposition; perverse; adverse; opposing.
Across; from alde to side of.
That which is overthwart; an adverse circumstance; opposition.

Overthwartly.def: In an overthwart manner; across; also, perversely.

Overthwartness.def: The state of being overthwart; perverseness.

Overtime.def: Time beyond, or in excess of, a limit; esp., extra working time.

Overtire.def: To tire to excess; to exhaust.

Overtitle.def: To give too high a title to.

Overtone.def: One of the harmonics faintly heard with and above a tone as it dies away, produced by some aliquot portion of the vibrating sting or column of air which yields the fundamental tone; one of the natural harmonic scale of tones, as the octave, twelfth, fifteenth, etc.; an aliquot or "partial" tone; a harmonic. See Harmonic, and Tone.

Overtop.def: To rise above the top of; to exceed in height; to tower above.
To go beyond; to transcend; to transgress.
To make of less importance, or throw into the background, by superior excellence; to dwarf; to obscure.

Overtrade.def: To trade beyond one's capital; to buy goods beyond the means of paying for or seleng them; to overstock the market.

Overtrading.def: The act or practice of buying goods beyond the means of payment; a glutting of the market.

Overtrow.def: To be too trustful or confident; to trust too much.

Overture.def: An opening or aperture; a recess; a recess; a chamber.
A proposal; an offer; a proposition formally submitted for consideration, acceptance, or rejection.
A composition, for a full orchestra, designed as an introduction to an oratorio, opera, or ballet, or as an independent piece; -- called in the latter case a concert overture.
To make an overture to; as, to overture a religious body on some subject.

Overturn.def: To turn or throw from a basis, foundation, or position; to overset; as, to overturn a carriage or a building.
To subvert; to destroy; to overthrow.
The act off overturning, or the state of being overturned or subverted; overthrow; as, an overturn of parties.

Overturnable.def: Capable of being, or liable to be, overturned or subverted.

Overvalue.def: To value excessively; to rate at too high a price.

Overvote.def: To outvote; to outnumber in votes given.

Overwatch.def: To weary or exhaust by watching.

Overwax.def: To wax or grow too rapindly or too much.

Overwear.def: To wear too much; to wear out.

Overweary.def: To weary too much; to tire out.

Overweather.def: To expose too long to the influence of the weather.

Overween.def: To think too highly or arrogantly; to regard one's own thinking or conclusions too highly; hence, to egotistic, arrogant, or rash, in opinion; to think conceitedly; to presume.

Overweigh.def: To exceed in weight; to overbalance; to weigh down.

Overweight.def: Weight over and above what is required by law or custom.

Overwhelm.def: To cover over completely, as by a great wave; to overflow and bury beneath; to ingulf; hence, figuratively, to immerse and bear down; to overpower; to crush; to bury; to oppress, etc., overpoweringly.
To project or impend over threateningly.
To cause to surround, to cover.

Overwind.def: To wind too tightly, as a spring, or too far, as a hoisting rope on a drum.

Overword.def: To say in too many words; to express verbosely.

Overwork.def: To work beyond the strength; to cause to labor too much or too long; to tire excessively; as, to overwork a horse.
To fill too full of work; to crowd with labor.
To work too much, or beyond one's strength.
Work in excess of the usual or stipulated time or quantity; extra work; also, excessive labor.

Overworn.def: Worn out or subdued by toil; worn out so as to be trite.

Overwrest.def: To wrest or force from the natural or proper position.

Ovicapsule.def: The outer layer of a Graafian follicle.

Ovicell.def: One of the dilatations of the body wall of Bryozoa in which the ova sometimes undegro the first stages of their development. See Illust. of Chilostoma.

Ovioular.def: Of or pertaining to an egg.

Ovicyst.def: The pouch in which incubation takes place in some Tunicata.

Ovidian.def: Of or pertaining to the Latin poet Ovid; resembling the style of Ovid.

Oviducal.def: Of or pertaining to oviducts; as, oviducal glands.

Oviduct.def: A tube, or duct, for the passage of ova from the ovary to the exterior of the animal or to the part where further development takes place. In mammals the oviducts are also called Fallopian tubes.

Oviferous.def: Egg-bearing; -- applied particularly to certain receptacles, as in Crustacea, that retain the eggs after they have been excluded from the formative organs, until they are hatched.

Oviform.def: Having the form or figure of an egg; egg-shaped; as, an oviform leaf.

Ovine.def: Of or pertaining to sheep; consisting of sheep.

Ovipara.def: An artifical division of vertebrates, including those that lay eggs; -- opposed to Vivipara.

Oviparity.def: Generation by means of ova. See Generation.

Oviparous.def: Producing young from rggs; as, an oviparous animal, in which the egg is generally separated from the animal, and hatched after exclusion; -- opposed to viviparous.

Oviposit.def: To lay or deposit eggs; -- said esp. of insects.

Oviposition.def: The depositing of eggs, esp. by insects.

Ovipositor.def: The organ with which many insects and some other animals deposit their eggs. Some ichneumon files have a long ovipositor fitted to pierce the eggs or larvae of other insects, in order to lay their own eggs within the same.

Ovisac.def: A Graafian follicle; any sac containing an ovum or ova.
The inner layer of the fibrous wall of a Graafian follicle.

Ovoidal.def: Resembling an egg in shape; egg-shaped; ovate; as, an ovoidal apple.

Ovoid.def: A solid resembling an egg in shape.

Ovolo.def: A round, convex molding. See Illust. of Column.

Ovology.def: That branch of natural history which treats of the origin and functions of eggs.

Ovotesttis.def: An organ which produces both ova and spermatozoids; an hermaphrodite gland.

Ovoviviparous.def: Oviparous, but hatching the egg while it is within the body, as some fishes and reptiles.

Ovular.def: Relating or belonging to an ovule; as, an ovular growth.

Ovulation.def: The formation of ova or eggs in the ovary, and the discharge of the same. In the mammalian female the discharge occurs during menstruation.

Ovule.def: The rudiment of a seed. It grows from a placenta, and consists of a soft nucleus within two delicate coatings. The attached base of the ovule is the hilum, the coatings are united with the nucleus at the chalaza, and their minute orifice is the foramen.

Ovulist.def: A believer in the theory (called encasement theory), current during the last century, that the egg was the real animal germ, and that at the time of fecundation the spermatozoa simply gave the impetus which caused the unfolding of the egg, in which all generations were inclosed one within the other. Also called ovist.

Ovum.def: A more or less spherical and transparent mass of granular protoplasm, which by a process of multiplication and growth develops into a mass of cells, constituting a new individual like the parent; an egg, spore, germ, or germ cell. See Illust. of Mycropyle.
One of the series of egg-shaped ornaments into which the ovolo is often carved.

Owe.def: To possess; to have, as the rightful owner; to own.

To have or possess, as something derived or bestowed; to be obliged to ascribe (something to some source); to be indebted or obliged for; as, he owed his wealth to his father; he owed his victory to his lieutenants.

Hence: To have or be under an obigation to restore, pay, or render (something) in return or compensation for something received; to be indebted in the sum of; as, the subject owes allegiance; the fortunate owe assistance to the unfortunate.
To have an obligation to (some one) on account of something done or received; to be indebted to; as, to iwe the grocer for supplies, or a laborer for services.

Owelty.def: Equality; -- sometimes written ovelty and ovealty.

Owenite.def: A follower of Robert Owen, who tried to reorganize society on a socialistic basis, and established an industrial community on the Clyde, Scotland, and, later, a similar one in Indiana.

Owing.def: Had or held under obligation of paying; due.
Had or experienced as a consequence, result, issue, etc.; ascribable; -- with to; as, misfortunes are often owing to vices; his failure was owing to speculations.

Owl.def: Any species of raptorial birds of the family Strigidae. They have large eyes and ears, and a conspicuous circle of feathers around each eye. They are mostly nocturnal in their habits.
A variety of the domestic pigeon.
To carry wool or sheep out of England.
Hence, to carry on any contraband trade.

Owler.def: One who owls; esp., one who conveys contraband goods. See Owling, n.

Owlery.def: An abode or a haunt of owls.

Owlet.def: A small owl; especially, the European species (Athene noctua), and the California flammulated owlet (Megascops flammeolus).

Owling.def: The offense of transporting wool or sheep out of England contrary to the statute formerly existing.

Owlish.def: Resembling, or characteristic of, an owl.

Own.def: To grant; to acknowledge; to admit to be true; to confess; to recognize in a particular character; as, we own that we have forfeited your love.

Belonging to; belonging exclusively or especially to; peculiar; -- most frequently following a possessive pronoun, as my, our, thy, your, his, her, its, their, in order to emphasize or intensify the idea of property, peculiar interest, or exclusive ownership; as, my own father; my own composition; my own idea; at my own price.
To hold as property; to have a legal or rightful title to; to be the proprietor or possessor of; to possess; as, to own a house.

Owner.def: One who owns; a rightful proprietor; one who has the legal or rightful title, whether he is the possessor or not.

Ownership.def: The state of being an owner; the right to own; exclusive right of possession; legal or just claim or title; proprietorship.

Ox.def: The male of bovine quadrupeds, especially the domestic animal when castrated and grown to its full size, or nearly so. The word is also applied, as a general name, to any species of bovine animals, male and female.

Oxalan.def: A complex nitrogenous substance C3N3H5O3 obtained from alloxan (or when urea is fused with ethyl oxamate), as a stable white crystalline powder; -- called also oxaluramide.

Oxalantin.def: A white crystalline nitrogenous substance (C6H4N4O5)  obtained by the reduction of parabanic acid; -- called also leucoturic acid.

Oxalethyline.def: A poisonous nitrogenous base (C6H10N2) obtained indirectly from oxamide as a thick transparent oil which has a strong narcotic odor, and a physiological action resembling that of atropine. It is probably related to pyridine.

Oxalic.def: Pertaining to, derived from, or contained in, sorrel, or oxalis; specifically, designating an acid found in, and characteristic of, oxalis, and also certain plant of the Buckwheat family.

Oxalis.def: A genus of plants, mostly herbs, with acid-tasting trifoliolate or multifoliolate leaves; -- called also wood sorrel.

Oxalite.def: A yellow mineral consisting of oxalate of iron.

Oxaluric.def: Pertaining to, or designating, a complex nitrogenous acid related to the ureids, and obtained from parabanic acid as a white silky crystalline substance.

Oxalyl.def: A hydrocarbon radical (C2O2) regarded as a residue of oxalic acid and occurring in derivatives of it.

Oxamethane.def: Ethyl oxamate, obtained as a white scaly crystalline powder.

Oxamethylane.def: Methyl oxamate, obtained as a pearly white crystalline substance.

Oxamic.def: Pertaining to, or designating, an acid NH2.C2O2.HO obtained as a fine crystalline powder, intermediate between oxalic acid and oxamide. Its ammonium salt is obtained by boiling oxamide with ammonia.

Oxamide.def: A white crystalline neutral substance (C2O2(NH2)2) obtained by treating ethyl oxalate with ammonia. It is the acid amide of oxalic acid.  Formerly called also oxalamide.

Oxamidine.def: One of a series of bases containing the amido and the isonitroso groups united to the same carbon atom.

Oxanillamide.def: A white crystalline nitrogenous substance, obtained indirectly by the action of cyanogen on aniline, and regarded as an anilide of oxamic acid; -- called also phenyl oxamide.

Oxanilic.def: Pertaining to, or derived from, oxalic acid and aniline; -- used to designate an acid obtained in white crystalline scales by heating these substances together.

Oxanilide.def: a white crystalline substance, resembling oxanilamide, obtained by heating aniline oxalate, and regarded as a double anilide of oxalic acid; -- called also diphenyl oxamide.

Oxbane.def: A poisonous bulbous plant (Buphane toxicaria) of the Cape of Good Hope.

Oxbow.def: A frame of wood, bent into the shape of the letter U, and embracing an ox's neck as a kind of collar, the upper ends passing through the bar of the yoke; also, anything so shaped, as a bend in a river.

Oxeye.def: The oxeye daisy. See under Daisy.
A genus of composite plants (Buphthalmum) with large yellow flowers.
A titmouse, especially the great titmouse (Parus major) and the blue titmouse (P. coeruleus).
A fish; the bogue, or box.

Oxeyed.def: Having large, full eyes, like those of an ox.

Oxford.def: Of or pertaining to the city or university of Oxford, England.

Oxhead.def: Literally, the head of an ox (emblem of cuckoldom); hence, a dolt; a blockhead.

Oxheart.def: A large heart-shaped cherry, either black, red, or white.

Oxhide.def: The skin of an ox, or leather made from it.
A measure of land. See 3d Hide.

Oxidability.def: Capability of being converted into an oxide.

Oxidable.def: Capable of being converted into an oxide.

Oxidation.def: The act or process of oxidizing, or the state or result of being oxidized.

Oxidator.def: A contrivance for causing a current of air to impinge on the flame of the Argand lamp; -- called also oxygenator.

Oxide.def: A binary compound of oxygen with an atom or radical, or a compound which is regarded as binary; as, iron oxide, ethyl oxide, nitrogen oxide, etc.

Oxidize.def: To combine with oxygen, or subject to the action of oxygen, or of an oxidizing agent.
To combine with oxygen or with more oxygen; to add oxygen to; as, to oxidize nitrous acid so as to form nitric acid.
To remove hydrogen from (anything), as by the action of oxygen; as, to oxidize alcohol so as to form aldehyde.
To subject to the action of oxygen or of an oxidizing agent, so as to bring to a higher grade, as an -ous compound to an -ic compound; as, to oxidize mercurous chloride to mercuric chloride.

Oxidizer.def: An agent employed in oxidation, or which facilitates or brings about combination with oxygen; as, nitric acid, chlorine, bromine, etc., are strong oxidizers.

Oxidulated.def: Existing in the state of a protoxide; -- said of an oxide.

Oxime.def: One of a series of isonitroso derivatives obtained by the action of hydroxylamine on aldehydes or ketones.

Oxindol.def: A white crystalline nitrogenous substance (C8H7NO) of the indol group, obtained by the reduction of dioxindol. It is a so-called lactam compound.

Oxiodic.def: Pertaining to, or designating, certain compounds of iodine and oxygen.

Oxlike.def: Characteristic of, or like, an ox.

Oxlip.def: The great cowslip (Primula veris, var. elatior).

Oxonian.def: Of or relating to the city or the university of Oxford, England.
A student or graduate of Oxford University, in England.

Oxonic.def: Pertaining to, or designating, a complex nitrogenous acid (C4H5N3O4) not known in the free state, but obtained, in combination with its salts, by a slow oxidation of uric acid, to which it is related.

Oxpecker.def: An African bird of the genus Buphaga; the beefeater.

Oxshoe.def: A shoe for oxen, consisting of a flat piece of iron nailed to the hoof.

Oxtongue.def: A name given to several plants, from the shape and roughness of their leaves; as, Anchusa officinalis, a kind of bugloss, and Helminthia echioides, both European herbs.

Oxy-.def: A compound containing the hydroxyl group, more properly designated by hydroxy-. See Hydroxy-.

Oxyacetic.def: Hydroxyacetic; designating an acid called also glycolic acid.

Oxyacid.def: An acid containing oxygen, as chloric acid or sulphuric acid; -- contrasted with the hydracids, which contain no oxygen, as hydrochloric acid. See Acid, and Hydroxy-.

Oxybenzoic.def: Hydroxybenzoic; pertaining to, or designating, any one of several hydroxyl derivatives of benzonic acid, of which the commonest is salicylic acid.

Oxybromic.def: Pertaining to, or designating, certain compounds of oxygen and bromine.

Oxybutyric.def: Hydroxybutyric; designating any one of a group of metameric acids (C3H6.OH.CO2H).

Oxycalcium.def: Of or pertaining to oxygen and calcium; as, the oxycalcium light. See Drummond light.

Oxychloric.def: Of, pertaining to, or designating in general, certain compounds containing oxygen and chlorine.
Formerly designating an acid now called perchloric acid. See Perchloric.

Oxychloride.def: A ternary compound of oxygen and chlorine; as, plumbic oxychloride.

Oxycrate.def: A Mixture of water and vinegar.

Oxygen.def: A colorless, tasteless, odorless, gaseous element occurring in the free state in the atmosphere, of which it forms about 23 per cent by weight and about 21 per cent by volume, being slightly heavier than nitrogen. Symbol O. Atomic weight 15.96.

Oxygenate.def: To unite, or cause to combine, with oxygen; to treat with oxygen; to oxidize; as, oxygenated water (hydrogen dioxide).

Oxygenation.def: The act or process of combining or of treating with oxygen; oxidation.

Oxygenic.def: Pertaining to, containing, or resembling, oxygen; producing oxygen.

Oxygon.def: A triangle having three acute angles.

Oxyhydrogen.def: Of or pertaining to a mixture of oxygen and hydrogen; as, oxyhydrogen gas.

Oxymel.def: A mixture of honey, water, vinegar, and spice, boiled to a sirup.

Oxymethylene.def: Formic aldehyde, regarded as a methylene derivative.

Oxymoron.def: A figure in which an epithet of a contrary signification is added to a word; e. g., cruel kindness; laborious idleness.

Oxymuriate.def: A salt of the supposed oxymuriatic acid; a chloride.

Oxymuriatic.def: Pertaining to, or consisting of, oxygen and muriatic acid, that is, hydrochloric acid.

Oxyntic.def: Acid; producing acid; -applied especially to certain glands and cells in the stomach.

Oxyphenic.def: Pertaining to, or designating, the phenol formerly called oxyphenic acid, and now oxyphenol and pyrocatechin. See Pyrocatechin.

Oxyphenol.def: A phenol, /////, produced by the distillation of catechin; called also oxyphenic acid, and now pyrocatechin.

Oxyquinoline.def: Hydroxy quinoline; a phenol derivative of quinoline, -- called also carbostyril.

Oxyrrhodine.def: A mixture of two parts of the oil of roses with one of the vinegar of roses.

Oxysalt.def: A salt of an oxyacid, as a sulphate.

Oxysulphide.def: A ternary compound of oxygen and sulphur.

Oxytoluene.def: One of three hydroxy derivatives of toluene, called the cresols. See Cresol.

Oxytone.def: Having an acute sound; (Gr. Gram.), having an acute accent on the last syllable.
A word having the acute accent on the last syllable.

Oyer.def: A hearing or an inspection, as of a deed, bond, etc., as when a defendant in court prays oyer of a writing.

Oyez.def: Hear; attend; -- a term used by criers of courts to secure silence before making a proclamation. It is repeated three times.

Oyster.def: Any marine bivalve mollusk of the genus Ostrea. They are usually found adhering to rocks or other fixed objects in shallow water along the seacoasts, or in brackish water in the mouth of rivers. The common European oyster (Ostrea edulis), and the American oyster (Ostrea Virginiana), are the most important species.
A name popularly given to the delicate morsel contained in a small cavity of the bone on each side of the lower part of the back of a fowl.

Oyster-green.def: A green membranous seaweed (Ulva) often found growing on oysters but common on stones, piles, etc.

Ozena.def: A discharge of fetid matter from the nostril, particularly if associated with ulceration of the soft parts and disease of the bones of the nose.

Ozocerite.def: A waxlike mineral resin; -- sometimes called native paraffin, and mineral wax.

Ozonation.def: The act of treating with ozone; also, the act of converting into, or producing, ozone; ozonization.

Ozone.def: A colorless gaseous substance (O/) obtained (as by the silent discharge of electricity in oxygen) as an allotropic form of oxygen, containing three atoms in the molecule. It is a streng oxidizer, and probably exists in the air, though by he ordinary tests it is liable to be confused with certain other substances, as hydrogen dioxide, or certain oxides of nitrogen. It derives its name from its peculiar odor, which resembles that of weak chlorine.

Ozonic.def: Pertaining to, resembling, or containing, ozone.

Ozonification.def: The act or process of producing, or of subjecting to the action of, ozone.

Ozonize.def: To convert into ozone, as oxygen.

Ozonizer.def: An apparatus or agent for the production or application of ozone.

Ozonometer.def: An instrument for ascertaining the amount of ozone in the atmosphere, or in any gaseous mixture.

Ozonometric.def: Pertaining to, or used for, the determination of the amount of ozone; of or relating to ozonometry.

Ozonometry.def: The measurement or determination of the quantity of ozone.

Ozonoscope.def: An apparatus employed to indicate the presence, or the amount, of ozone.

Ozonoscopic.def: Serving to indicate the presence or the amount of ozone.
